intro: Cytisus laburnum var. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-flowered laburnum, is a variant of the common laburnum, characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. It is a deciduous shrub native to southern Europe, particularly in regions of Spain and Portugal. The plant features slender, yellowish-green stems with thorn-like projections and pinnate leaves composed of 7–13 small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are borne in pendulous racemes and bloom in late spring to early summer. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and its ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
